org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.query

Interface QueryOptimizer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardQueryOptimizer

    public interface QueryOptimizer
    A QueryOptimizer is an object responsible for rewriting a ChronoDBQuery into another query with equal semantics but improved resource usage.

    Usually, this manifests itself in the fact that the returned optimized query produces the same result set as the input query, but is likely to execute faster and/or is likely to uses fewer memory resources.

    Please note that an optimizer that simply returns the input query also fulfills the contract and is therefore a valid (yet not very useful) optimizer.

    Query optimizer implementations are assumed to be immutalbe (in the ideal case stateless) and therefore thread-safe!

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ChronoDBQuery optimize(ChronoDBQuery query)
      Optimizes the given query.

    • Method Detail

      • optimize

        ChronoDBQuery optimize(ChronoDBQuery query)
        Optimizes the given query.

        All implementations of this method are assumed to be thread-safe by ChronoDB!

        Parameters:
        query - The query to optimize. Will not be modified. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The optimized query. May be equal to the input query, may also be the same object (with respect to the == operator). Never null.
